descriptions.content:
The marker དུ་ (and its variants སུ་, རུ་, ཏུ་) has locative (with or without movement) case functions. It also functions as adverbial suffix and marker of object incorporation.

Examples in the locative:

  • གཡོན་དུ་ “On / to the left”
  • གཡས་སུ་ “On / to the right”
  • རྒྱ་གར་དུ་འགྲོ་ “To go to India”
  • རྡོ་རྗེ་གླིང་དུ་སྡོད་ “To live in Darjeeling”
  • དུས་སུ་ “At the time”
  • ལག་ཏུ་ཕྲེང་བ་ “A rosary in the hand”
  • ཕ་ཡུལ་རྒྱབ་ཏུ་བསྐྱུར་ “To leave one’s native land behind”

Examples of object incorporation:

  • དཔལ་དུ་འབར་ “To be resplendent” (Literally: “To blaze in glory”)
  • ཐུང་དུ་གཏོང་ “To shorten” (Literally: “To send to small”)

Examples of adverbial use:

  • ལྷག་པར་དུ་ “Particularly”
  • ངེས་པར་དུ་ “Absolutely”

Note that the marker དུ་ (and its variants), as well as the marker ལ་ are associated with the adverb ཇེ་ “even more” which is used only in the literary language. In the spoken language, the oblique case དུ་ (or rather its variant རུ་) alone conveys this meaning.

  • ཇེ་མང་དུ་འཕེལ་ “To increase even more”
  • བདག་འཛིན་ཉོན་མོངས་རྣམ་རྟོག་སོགས་ཇེ་ཆུང་ཇེ་ཆུང་ལ་སོང་། “Selfishness, negative emotions, discursive thought, and so on decrease even further.”

The marker དུ་ has connective functions when it is followed by a verb. It is also used to form purpose clauses.

  • བོད་སྨན་སློབ་ཏུ་གཏོང་ “To send (someone) to learn Tibetan medicine”
